channel.title: Get-It-Done Guy's Quick and Dirty Tips to Work Less and Do More
channel.itunes:subtitle: Quick and Dirty Tips to Work Less and Do More
channel.itunes:author: QuickAndDirtyTips.com
channel.itunes:summary: Want to work smarter, not harder? Here's how to do it. Join Stever Robbins, author of "Get-It-Done Guy's 9 Steps to Work Less and Do More," each week as he provides inventive productivity and organization tips to transform even the most overwhelmed person into an overachiever. Are you buried in email? Stever will tell you how to dig your way out. Is technology holding you captive? Stever will help you evaluate your devices and only use the ones that actually help you get stuff done.
channel.description: Want to work smarter, not harder? Here's how to do it. Join Stever Robbins, author of "Get-It-Done Guy's 9 Steps to Work Less and Do More", each week as he provides inventive productivity and organization tips to transform even the most overwhelmed person into an overachiever. Are you buried in email? Stever will tell you how to dig your way out. Is technology holding you captive? Stever will help you evaluate your devices and only use the ones that actually help you get stuff done.

item.title: 472 - 4 Ways to Build Close Relationships That Last
item.itunes:subtitle: Build relationships by giving something other than what you get
item.itunes:summary:
Every relationship has a give and a take. The best relationships are founded on the principle of giving something other than what you get.
Read the transcript at http://www.quickanddirtytips.com/relationships/professional/build-close-relationships-in-business-and-life Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 471 - How to Be Persuasive Using the Right Language Cues
item.itunes:subtitle: Speaking abstractly while using concrete examples is as persuasive as it gets.
item.itunes:summary:
Not everyone communicates the same way. If you want to move people to action, you need to reach them in a way they understand: Use both abstract thinking and concrete examples to persuade them the smart way.
Read the transcript at http://www.quickanddirtytips.com/business-career/communication/how-to-be-persuasive-using-the-right-language-cues Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 470 - How Scanning Apps Can Organize Your Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Scanning apps come in all shapes and sizes
item.itunes:summary:
Scanning documents with your cell phone can be a huge time saver. Today, we review the major features to look for in a scanning app.
Read the transcript at http://www.quickanddirtytips.com/productivity/organization/how-scanning-apps-can-organize-your-life Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 469 GID How to Critique a Colleague's Bad Decisions in 4 Steps
item.itunes:subtitle: Have them thank you for telling them you're right
item.itunes:summary:
When you frame it the right way, you can give feedback in a way that gets the other person on your side.
Read the transcript at http://www.quickanddirtytips.com/node/11901 Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 468 GID How to Organize Purchased Products and Accessories
item.itunes:subtitle: Get more out of your devices by preserving the accessories
item.itunes:summary: Create an organization system for all the bits that come with products: physical accessories, AC adapters, and warranties.

item.title: 324 GID How to Deal With People Who are Late
item.itunes:subtitle: Life is too short to let people waste your time.
item.itunes:summary: When people are late, they're wasting time you'll have to make up later. But as Get-It-Done Guy reveals, there are things you can do to manage them--and their behavior. Read the full transcript: http://bit.ly/UStBNt

item.title: 389 GID Get More Out of College by Prioritizing Learning
item.itunes:subtitle: When choosing activities in college, maximize your learning.
item.itunes:summary: When priorities conflict in college, you can find yourself choosing between multiple good choices. At this stage of life, choose learning. Read the full transcript here: bit.ly/1Rbbey4

item.title: 414 GID How to Form Great Habits Using Triggers
item.itunes:subtitle: Use triggering times or locations to help fold activities into your routine.
item.itunes:summary: Making habits is hard. And most times we have to do them. But by attaching a trigger to the thing we want to do more of, it gets easier to just do it. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/29LKeEs

item.title: 467 GID Write Faster by Separating Cognitive Tasks
item.itunes:subtitle: Splitting writing into its component tasks helps you beat distraction
item.itunes:summary: There are many parallel tasks we do while writing, and computers can help with all of them. But doing them all at once is a distracting trap. Do the steps separately to keep focus and write faster.

item.title: 466 GID Make a Plan for Motivation
item.itunes:subtitle: Use plans everywhere to get unstuck
item.itunes:summary: Even an inaccurate or incomplete plan can give you the motivation to do great things. Use plans everywhere, even when you don't think you're ready for them, and even in places where you wouldn't normally think of planning.

item.title: 465 GID How to Make Your Own Luck
item.itunes:subtitle: Luck favors the prepared. Here's how to prepare.
item.itunes:summary: Luck is an essential ingredient to success! But by its nature, you can't plan for it. ... or can you?

item.title: 464 GID How to Organize Your Stuff for Camping
item.itunes:subtitle: Stay organized, even in *shudder* nature
item.itunes:summary:
Get all the convenience of a tidy, organized closet, even when you’re camping Read the transcript at http://www.quickanddirtytips.com/node/11481 Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 463 GID How to Send Perfect Calendar Invites
item.itunes:subtitle: Good calendar invites require careful crafting
item.itunes:summary: We often think of calendar invites as a quick throwaway activity. But they aren’t. They’re deliberate communication; treat them well!

item.title: 462 GID Take Charge of Your Career and Grow a Pair!
item.itunes:subtitle: Take control of your career by managing it with purpose
item.itunes:summary: Don't leave your career to chance. Decide where you want to go, and how you'll get there. Then get your boss on board--or find a new boss.

item.title: 380 GID Negotiate More Money with These Simple Tricks
item.itunes:subtitle: Being liked and being a good negotiator aren't mutually exclusive.
item.itunes:summary: Good negotiators can reach good outcomes and keep the relationship strong by thinking differently about how they approach the bargaining table. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1MlgV4E

item.title: 461 GID Control Email Using Custom Domains and Catch-All Emails
item.itunes:subtitle: Funnel site-specific emails into one inbox for convenience and security
item.itunes:summary: Lots of sites want your email address. Keep them organized (and honest) by giving them each a unique address at a custom domain.

item.title: 460 GID The Simple Trick to Keep Track of What People Owe You
item.itunes:subtitle: Use a delegation matrix to track colleagues' and bosses' deliverables
item.itunes:summary:
Great things that are more than one person can do require, well, multiple people. Delegating to others requires a good follow-up system. Fortunately, it’s just a tiny grid away.
Read the transcript at http://bit.ly/2tLFZRe
Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 459 GID Get Even More Organized With a Table of Contents
item.itunes:subtitle: A centuries old device is a key productivity tool
item.itunes:summary:
Is your life full of half-full notebooks and jotted information everywhere? A table of contents might be just the thing you need to clear out the clutter.
Read the transcript at http://bit.ly/2rAz78w Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 458 GID Orient Your Life Around Results Not Hours
item.itunes:subtitle: Orient your life around results, not hours
item.itunes:summary: We've been trained by our corporate overlords to care about giving our hours, even though we'd all be better off organizing our lives around progress.

item.title: 457 GID How Customer Pictures Can Improve Your A-Game
item.itunes:subtitle: Design an environment that makes you perform well
item.itunes:summary:
Put the right external cues in place and you can do better work for your customers.
Read the transcript at http://bit.ly/2stTi95
Check out all the Quick and Dirty Tips shows: www.quickanddirtytips.com/podcasts
FOLLOW GET-IT-DONE GUY Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GetItDoneGuy Twitter: https://twitter.com/GetItDoneGuy

item.title: 456 GID Keep Your Roles Separate by Switching Hats
item.itunes:subtitle: Create environmental markers so you automatically have the right behavior at the right time
item.itunes:summary: Different roles call for different actions. Avoid mix-ups between clashing roles by pairing them each with a context.

item.title: 455 GID How to Negotiate with Contingency Clauses
item.itunes:subtitle: Deal with the uncertain future by making agreements that account for different outcomes
item.itunes:summary: People can’t always agree on what will happen in the future. But they can agree to do something if something happens in the future. Use this to negotiate better across barriers in belief.

item.title: 454 GID How to Be Radically Candid: Q&A with Kim Scott, Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Can radical candor make you a better boss?
item.itunes:summary: In Part 2 of his interview with author and CEO Kim Scott, Git-It-Done-Guy learns how to be wrong, how to handle an angry boss, and why radical candor is the superior mode of interaction in the workplace.

item.title: 453 GID How to Be Radically Candid: Q&A with Kim Scott, Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: What is radical candor?
item.itunes:summary: Get-It-Done Guy sits down with Kim Scott to discuss how to show care for others by giving feedback and getting vulnerable. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/2qG2jtH

item.title: 452 GID PHow to Keep Track of Irregular Events
item.itunes:subtitle: Make sure your resources go toward the future.
item.itunes:summary: Scheduling the unscheduleable is a challenge. But with modern tools, as well as pen and paper, we can make sure you have what you need, when you need it, even if you don’t know enough to plan ahead in the traditional way. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/2py9Qx9
